str2: One. (including the neuter Hen); a primary numeral; one.
From out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards. A primary preposition denoting origin, from, out.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From the primary kapto; the head, literally or figuratively.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Neuter 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
Probably adverb of comparative from hos; which how, i.e. In that manner.

parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Middle or Passive - Accusative Feminine Singular
str2: To slay, kill by violence, slaughter, wound mortally. A primary verb; to butcher or to slaughter, or, to maim.
And, even, also, namely.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Death, physical or spiritual. From thnesko; death.
A blow, stripe, wound; an affliction, plague. From plesso; a stroke; by implication, a wound; figuratively, a calamity.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From the same as therapon; to wait upon menially, i.e. to adore, or to relieve.
And, even, also, namely.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
All, the whole, entire, complete. A primary word; 'whole' or 'all', i.e. Complete, especially as noun or adverb.
Contracted from a primary word; soil; by extension a region, or the solid part or the whole of the terrene globe.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: (a) intrans: I wonder, marvel, (b) trans: I wonder at, admire. From thauma; to wonder; by implication, to admire.
Behind, after; back, backwards. From the same as opisthen with enclitic of direction; to the back, i.e. Aback.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Properly: a wild beast, hence: any animal; met: a brute. Diminutive from the same as thera; a dangerous animal.
